policy.title: Exposure Control Plan For Bloodborne Pathogens

regulation.title: Exposure Control Plan For Bloodborne Pathogens

issues.title: Missing Annual Review and Update Requirements
issues.description: The Board Policy lacks any requirement for annual review and update of the exposure control plan itself. While the AR contains detailed update requirements, the BP should establish the board's commitment to maintaining current policies and ensuring regular oversight of this critical safety program.

legal_citations.text: The exposure control plan shall be reviewed and updated at least annually and whenever necessary to reflect new or modified tasks and procedures affecting occupational exposure

issues.required_language: The exposure control plan shall be reviewed and updated at least annually and whenever necessary to reflect changes in tasks, procedures, employee positions, or exposure incidents.

issues.title: Missing Training Requirements
issues.description: The Board Policy does not establish any requirements for employee training on bloodborne pathogens, which is a fundamental component of an exposure control plan. The AR contains detailed training provisions, but the BP should establish the board's commitment to ensuring proper employee education.

legal_citations.text: The employer shall ensure that all employees with occupational exposure participate in a training program... at the time of initial assignment to tasks where occupational exposure may take place and at least annually thereafter

issues.required_language: Employees with occupational exposure shall receive training on bloodborne pathogens at initial assignment and annually thereafter, at no cost to the employee and during working hours.

issues.title: Missing Post-Exposure Evaluation Requirements
issues.description: The Board Policy does not address post-exposure evaluation and follow-up procedures, which are required by state regulations. While the AR contains comprehensive post-exposure procedures, the BP should establish the board's commitment to providing immediate medical evaluation following exposure incidents.

legal_citations.text: Following a report of an exposure incident, the employer shall make immediately available to the exposed employee a confidential medical evaluation and follow-up

issues.required_language: Following any exposure incident, the district shall immediately provide confidential medical evaluation and follow-up to the affected employee at no cost.

issues.title: Missing Recordkeeping Policy Direction
issues.description: The Board Policy does not establish any direction regarding recordkeeping requirements for medical records, training records, or exposure incidents. While the AR contains detailed recordkeeping procedures, the BP should provide board-level direction on maintaining confidential records.

legal_citations.text: Medical records for each employee with occupational exposure shall be kept confidential... Records shall be maintained for specified periods

issues.required_language: The district shall maintain confidential records related to employee medical evaluations, training, and exposure incidents in accordance with state regulations.

issues.title: Missing Employee Access to Plan
issues.description: Neither the BP nor AR explicitly states that the exposure control plan must be accessible to employees upon request, though this is required by state regulations. This requirement should be included to ensure transparency and employee awareness.

legal_citations.text: The exposure control plan shall be accessible to employees upon request

issues.required_language: The exposure control plan shall be made accessible to employees upon request.
